race.name: FNLD GRVL
race.tagline: Scandinavia's largest gravel event—1,500 riders, Nordic summer, smooth Finnish roads.

climate.description: Mild temps (55-70°F), long daylight hours, low rain chance.

terrain.surface: Finnish gravel roads are smooth, well-maintained, fast. Rolling terrain, not mountainous. Nordic summer landscape—forests, lakes, open roads.

biased_opinion.summary: FNLD GRVL is Scandinavia's largest gravel event—1,500 riders, 200+ km (124 miles), smooth Finnish gravel roads, August Nordic summer. This is a destination event: international field, Finnish hospitality, midnight sun vibes. The course is smooth and fast (not technical), the weather is mild (55-70°F), and the scenery is quintessentially Nordic—forests, lakes, rolling terrain. If you want a gravel adventure in Scandinavia, this is the one. If you want technical suffering, look elsewhere.
strengths: Largest gravel event in Scandinavia (1,500 riders)
weaknesses: Not technical—smooth roads favor speed over skills
biased_opinion.bottom_line: If you want a Nordic gravel adventure and you're willing to travel, FNLD GRVL is worth it. It's not the hardest race, not the most technical, but it's a unique experience in a beautiful setting. The field is large, the organization is strong, and the Finnish hospitality is real. Just budget for Europe travel costs and don't expect Unbound-level suffering.

black_pill.title: EUROPE TRAVEL = $$$ AND LOGISTICS
black_pill.reality: FNLD GRVL is in Finland. That means international flights ($800-$1,500), bike shipping or rental ($200-$500), lodging, rental car, and €100-€150 entry. You're looking at $2,000+ for this race. Location varies by year, so you need to research logistics annually. English-language coverage is limited. This is a bucket-list adventure, not a casual race.
consequences: High total cost ($2,000+ for international travel)
Location varies—need to research each year
Not technical—if you want suffering, this isn't it
black_pill.expectation_reset: This is a destination gravel adventure in Scandinavia. Budget accordingly. The race is smooth and fast, not technical. The experience is the draw, not the course difficulty.

logistics.nearest_airport: Varies by year (Helsinki-Vantaa usually closest major hub)
logistics.alternate_airports: Check official website for year-specific location
logistics.lodging_note: Location varies. Finnish lodging generally expensive. Book early.
logistics.travel_summary: International travel to Finland. Helsinki is major hub. Rental car likely needed. Location varies annually—check official site. Budget for bike shipping or rental.
logistics.food_options: Aid stations on course. Finnish hospitality known.

course_description.character: Smooth Finnish gravel roads. Rolling terrain, not mountainous. 200+ km (124 miles), ~4,000 ft. Fast conditions, well-maintained surfaces. Nordic summer landscape.

suffering_zones.name: Long Distance Fatigue
suffering_zones.description: 124 miles is long. Smooth roads mean high speeds, which burn matches.
suffering_zones.survival_strategy: Pace conservatively early. Eat and drink consistently. Save energy for last 30 miles.

suffering_zones.name: Wind Exposure
suffering_zones.description: Finnish open roads = wind exposure. Can sap energy.
suffering_zones.survival_strategy: Draft when possible. Aero position helps.

course_description.signature_challenge: Long distance (124 miles) on smooth fast roads. High pace can surprise you.

history.origin_story: FNLD GRVL is Scandinavia's largest gravel event. 1,000-1,500 riders. Location varies by year. International field, strong Finnish organization.
history.reputation: Scandinavia's premier gravel event. Destination race.
